column2: gonzo, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: no problems what so ever and it takes care of my pain in my knees

column2: michelle, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Balacet in place of Darvocet for over a year now. (fibromyalgia) I like that i'm taking less tylenol and i like the fact i don't have the euphoria as with other pain killers. It doesn't take care of all my pain, i consider it mild, but in order to stay off of anything stronger it takes care of enough for right now.

column2: ajlandis, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have a 4mth old and have been diagnosed with osteoarthritis in my knee, and it really helps relieve the arthritis pain without knocking me out. I dont feel loopy or wried like other ones ive tried, plus I dont want to be like that having to take care of my daughter. I really recommend this to anyone with OA pain, and that wants something stronger than motrion and tylenol, but not making you knocked out

column2: Boyd305, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed balacet for chronic headaches.  It works great when taken at onset of headache.

column2: gttownsend55, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column9: It has ease the pain better than any thingI took.I only take as need.

column2: tracking12007@comcast.net, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken many medications over the years due to a spinal cord injury.  My spine slips on my pelvis.  I've had knee replacement and epidermals on my theracic and lower spine.  I've done acupuncture and now my doctor has put me on Balacet 325 which isn't giving me any relief.  I understand the reasons for less asperin because of my liver but there has got to be something out there that will keep me pain free or something close

column2: Always in PAIN, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried many differant pain meds. I have had 18 surgeries and have been in and out of the hospital my whole life. I really like Balacet. Darvacet always made me feel really wierd, not high wierd but just I felt nasty. Its hard to explain,but anyway I don't get that with Balacet. I am taking Methadone for my chronic pain and the Balacet for my breakthru. I am very well maintained on the two together. I highly recommend Balacet.

column2: balacet, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: helps with my pain

column2: gaymor, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: For jaw pain.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Balacet worked great for me. It did not effect my breathing like Darvocet did. This medicine works great for my back pain from a compressed disk. I would recommend this over Darvocet or Vicodin any day>

column2: ZwolleBoiler,  Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Partially effective, with minimal side effects. However, seems to increase sensitivity to extreme heat (120+ degrees). Overall not bad for it's intended purpose.

column2: doodlebug, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It helps with my pain, but it knocks me out, and when I wake up I don't know where I am at first and feel a little hung over.

column2: bjohns52, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have a herniated disc in the lower back and it help me with pains, expecially when i get home from work

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have several chronic conditions that cause moderate to severe pain.  Darvocet makes me sick, but Balacet does not.  It does not kill all the pain, and it gives me a slight headache, but it makes my daily life much more managable.  For me the effectiveness outweighs the side effects. It has been added to my prescriptions of muscle relaxers and anti-inflammatories that just weren't doing me justice on their own. I would recommend it as a starting point for anyone with a chronic pain condition.

column2: Care Bear 911, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I hurt my knee on the job and was diagnosed with early arthritis and now have mild to sever pain. One of these helps almost any pain I am having with no dopey side effects, two of them will knock me out which is usually the goal to help me sleep at night with out pain. And I can still wake up in the morning which is more than I can say for Tylenol PM.

column2: BALACET 325mg, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I HAVE BEEN TAKING BALACET FOR 3 DAYS NOW FOR A TERRIBLE BACKACHE. THE MEDICATION DOES HELP SOMEWHAT BUT IS NOT STRONG ENOUGH FOR MY PAIN. I WILL CONTINUE TAKING IT AND HOPEFULLY WHEN I GET MORE BALACET IN MY SYSTEM IT WILL RELEIVE MORE PAIN.  MONA D.

column2: nina198, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have fibromyalgia and have taken this medication for about 5 to 6 years. I have ha great results from this medication. My ose has not changed since I began taking it.
